posts.name: Bakesale Bette's
posts.note: Bakesale Bette's is a lunchtime bakery is a popular take-out stop for hefty fried chicken sandwiches and classic desserts. You need to order the fried chicken sandwich with home-made coke slaw.

posts.name: Clove and Hoof
posts.note: Clove and Hoof is a hip butcher shop displaying daily meats in a modern setting with cafe seating for bistro dishes. Order their version of a Philly cheesesteak or the fried chicken sandwich with fish sauce caramel.

posts.name: Reem's California (Fruitvale)
posts.note: Reem's California (Fruitvale) is a counter-serve bakery and cafe with outdoor seats that serve Arab flatbreads, meze, pastries, and coffee. From Reem's website, 'In 2010, the dream of Reem's was born at the doorstep of a street corner bakery in Beirut, Lebanon. The scent of za'atar, yeasted bread, and sweet orange blossom syrup right out of the oven and the sounds of laughter and chatter in Arabic all around me conjured up memories of my childhood and my yearning to create home and community in the United States. On a soul searching trip to Lebanon and Syria, I decided to bring this experience to the Bay. I wanted to bring more than just a bakery. I wanted to recreate the sights, sounds, tastes, and aromas of the streets of Damascus and Beirut, and at the same time, a space that feels familiar and inviting to all cultures. I wanted to create a sense of home.'

posts.name: Scolari's Good Eat’s
posts.note: Scolari's Good Eat’s is a compact go-to for Stromboli, burgers, and Buffalo fries with optional delivery to the bar next door. Order the blue cheese and blueberry burger with scampi fries or the Good Old Boy' Nashville Hot Chicken sandwich.

posts.name: Shandong Restaurant
posts.note: Shandong Restaurant is a buzzing eatery featuring traditional Chinese staples in a bright, straight-up setting. You should order the Shan Dong dumplings which are the best handmade Dumplings in the Bay Area according to them.

posts.name: Souley Vegan
posts.note: Souley Vegan is a warm corner eatery preparing vegan versions of Louisiana-style soul food, plus cocktails and desserts.

posts.name: Southern Café
posts.note: Southern Café is a down-home Southern eatery serving up fried chicken, oxtails, and collard greens for both lunch and dinner. They're known for their catfish dinner or the fried chicken with black-eyed peas and mac and cheese or the oxtails dinner with collard greens and black-eyed peas. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Tacos Oscar
posts.note: From the Eater San Francisco website, 'Tacos Oscar has been roaming Oakland’s art and music scene for almost five years now, selling tacos and quesadillas from a propane-fueled plancha in alleys, at bars, and just about anywhere. Now, founders Oscar Michel and Jake Weiss have found themselves a permanent taco haven. The goal is to change the menu once a week, based on what produce is showing up at the markets. There’s always a vegan option, alongside meaty fillings like pork chile Verde with cilantro, onions, and chicharrones, and chorizo con papa frittata tacos with roasted tomato and puya chile salsa, shredded lettuce, queso fresco, and pickled onions.'

posts.name: Tamales Mi Lupita
posts.note: Tamales Mi Lupita is an acclaimed food truck serving Mexican tacos, tamales, Salvadoran pupusas, and empanadas.

posts.name: W. E. P. A. Brix 581
posts.note: W. E. P. A. Brix 581 is a Puerto Rican hot spot is known for its bold flavors and (bottomless) brunch bashes. Regulars love the Chicharron Mofongo and Canoa, but the restaurant also offers up some incredible vegan options.
